alert.note: Alert for Butler; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 11:31PM CDT until March 31 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN BUTLER AND SOUTHEASTERN WILCOX COUNTIES... At 1131 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 5 miles northeast of Pine Apple, or 20 miles east of Camden, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Butler and southeastern Wilcox Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
